t: Psalm 45
A Royal Wedding Song
For the choir director: according to “The Lilies.” A Maskil of the sons of Korah. A love song.
My*pn heart is moved by a noble theme as*ln I recite my verses to the king; my*ln tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.
You*ln are the most handsome of men; grace*ln flows from your lips. Therefore*ln God has blessed you forever.
Mighty*pn warrior, strap your sword at your side. In*ln your majesty and splendor—
in*ln your splendor ride triumphantly in*ln the cause of truth, humility, and justice. May*ln your right hand show your awe-inspiring acts.
Your*ln sharpened arrows pierce the hearts of the king’s enemies; the*ln peoples fall under you.
Your*pn throne, God, is forever and ever; the*ln scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of justice.
You*ln love righteousness and hate wickedness; therefore*ln God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of joy more*ln than your companions.
Myrrh,*ln aloes, and cassia perfume all your garments; from*ln ivory palaces harps bring you joy.
Kings’*ln daughters are among your honored women; the*ln queen, adorned with gold from Ophir, stands*ln at your right hand.
Listen,*pn daughter, pay attention and consider: Forget*ln your people and your father’s house,
and*ln the king will desire your beauty. Bow*ln down to him, for he is your lord.
The*ln daughter of Tyre, the wealthy people, will*ln seek your favor with gifts.
In*pn her chamber, the royal daughter is all glorious, her*ln clothing embroidered with gold.
In*ln colorful garments she is led to the king; after*ln her, the virgins, her companions, are brought to you.
They*ln are led in with gladness and rejoicing; they*ln enter the king’s palace.
Your*pn sons will succeed your ancestors; you*ln will make them princes throughout the land.
I*ln will cause your name to be remembered for all generations; therefore*ln the peoples will praise you forever and ever.
